title: Link from abesamma: 5a6d9517c1f6efc853c2
text:
A presentation given at Wikimania 2021 about Wikis in general using ~TiddlyWiki as a case study.

Title: Mapping the present and future of the Wiki philosophy: challenges and opportunities

Wikipedia remains the most successful manifestation of wikis to date. Its influence is undeniable, ranking 13th in the top 15 websites online by Alexa Internet, surpassing even the likes of Instagram and Netflix. It draws in more than 1.7 billion unique visits per month who come to view its extensive spread of articles written in 321 languages. Almost every web search yields a card with information from Wikipedia. However, its success has lead to a form of functional fixedness; There is more to wiki than just Wikipedia. The concept of wikis still offers many innovative possibilities, and there are many out there who are continuing to explore the frontiers of the 'Wiki philosophy'. Here, we give a brief overview of what lies ahead for wikis.

See the presentation [[here|https://abesamma.github.io/wikimania2021/]].

Declaration: these are links to materials authored by the poster of this tiddler

title: Link from abesamma: 77cddb8bbae52496aced
text:
Event details: https://talk.fission.codes/t/tools-for-thought-atjson-as-a-potential-format-for-interchange/1880

Time: May 27th, 09:00, (GMT-07:00) Pacific Time (US & Canada)

There will be a ~TiddlyWiki ebook demo by Jeremy.

Excerpt:


<<<
There are many #tools-for-thought, second brains, and digital garden apps out there, with more being built every day. How do we work on interchange between these systems?

Many people want Markdown as the One True Format, which they have become used to working with. But there isn’t even one standard for Markdown, never mind the front matter for metadata storage, various plugins, extensions, queries and other components that each system has.

We also don’t want any single large systems to be the de-facto standard that is fully owned by one private company, whether that is at the API layer or the export layer.

Can we work on ways to interchange data between systems in a way that preserves the unique capabilities of each system, while also allowing users and developers to more easily use different tools to work with their own data?
<<<
original-title: Tools for Thought: atJSON as a potential format for interchange

text: Locator provides a universal interface for navigating between your tiddlers and searching, filtering them without the need to write filter expressions. The plugin contains a table of contents macro and an enhanced search engine that contains a visual filter builder to filter results by tags and field values. You can organize the tiddlers to any number of trees, even by custom fields or links in text. Unlike classic Table of Contents, standard search, filter search and list of tags, this plugin handles these functions organically.

Have you ever been looking for something on Google and when you found the answer, you wanted to make a note of it, did you realize that you already had the answer in your TiddlyWiki? To avoid these situations by integrating TiddlyWiki search results to your preferred search engine's results, use this userscript with TiddlyWiki on Node.js.

Because the script searches in multiple TiddlyWikis at once, it can also be used to search in all your wikis.

title: Link from kookma: 78132cc25b648cf84989
text:
[[Mehregan|Mehregan Etymology and Origin]] is a Tiddlywiki based app for ''personal knowledge management''.

''Mehregan'' is a standalone [[Tiddlywiki|https://tiddlywiki.com]] app and acts as a single html file and can be used offline on a USB thumb drive with any modern browser.

''Mehregan'' implements a knowledge management system using Zettelkasten concept and is highly hackable to be shpaed based on your taste and needs.

''Features''

* Smart tabs
** Node explorer
** Keywords
** Tiny Todolist
** Comments

*Journals
** Interstitial journaling
** Today tasks
** Today activities (all tiddlers created/modified today)

* Category tabs (sidebar)
** Ideas
** Questions
** Journals
** Sources
** People
** Tag cloud
** Summary of Todos
* Keyboard shortcuts for frequent used actions
* Colorful tabs
* Iconized categories

<<alert info "''Mehregan'' also powered by Shiraz, Favorites, Commander, Utility, Trashbin, Relink, Relink-Titles, Link-to-Tabs, ~CodeMirror, Highlights, aand many other plugins to facilitate the knowledge management!">>
---

''Demo and code''

* Demo: https://kookma.github.io/TWE-Mehregan/
* Code: https://github.com/kookma/TWE-Mehregan

---

''Copyright''

Mehregan app content copyright © 2021 Mohammad Rahmani. The [[Tiddlywiki|https://tiddlywiki.com]] core and the plugins found in this app belong to their respective owners and are used under license.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 3a5a4e78d8cdc45d1679
text: A more powerful, general-purpose table of contents that can build hierarchies from fields or links, as well as doing additional filtering within the table of contents and the search.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 4a753172c0dc97e32fb8
text: Restores old TiddlyWiki Classic behavior of editing a tiddler by double-clicking anywhere in its body. Useful if you edit a lot and have longer tiddlers.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 5e6f6fded59d20040a99
text: Add-on to the core CodeMirror plugin that uses CSS styles to syntax-highlight TW5 wikitext while editing it.
tags: $:/tags/Link Plugin Editor Codemirror [[Syntax Highlighting]] Writing Authoring

title: Link from sobjornstad: 7ac8bf058c378ab8a7f7
text: The Book of TiddlyWiki: Advanced Customization – details on many of the internal mechanisms and special tiddlers and tags in TiddlyWiki and how you can hack on it.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 7e4b3bbc1d6881ecffce
text: A filter operator that shuffles the order of its inputs, useful for all kinds of randomization.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 85746b38d9d167f1e5b9
text: My TiddlyRemember plugin integrates TiddlyWiki with the spaced-repetition-flashcards tool Anki, so you can keep the most important bits of your notes at top of mind.

title: Link from sobjornstad: 9608c307452b75ef2d83
text: Embeds the popular Font Awesome icon font so you can easily use its icons in your wiki.

title: Link from sobjornstad: c76db3cb19acdca9ab57
text:
//Grok TiddlyWiki// is a textbook that helps you build a deep, lasting understanding of and proficiency with TiddlyWiki through a combination of detailed explanations, practical exercises, and spaced-repetition reviews of prompts called //takeaways//.

Promoting own work.

title: Link from sobjornstad: e6bc27c6aa87b0657edc
text: “The public musings of Soren Bjornstad” – notes and thoughts on a wide variety of topics linked together with TiddlyWiki.

title: Link from sobjornstad: f1ba4960f1fd5be87303
text: Essential plugin that allows you to rename tiddlers without breaking links, transclusions, macros, or any other references to the renamed tiddler.

title: Link from wikilabs: 11e05d16bb04d4ce0c6c
text:
! Space Space Newline

This plugin adds the possibility to add hard linebreaks into prose wikitext.

title: Link from wikilabs: 137e53d7eb17aec2e145
text:
! New Tiddler from Search

This plugin adds a "New Tiddler" template, into the default search input element, that uses the "search term" as title
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link Searching Navigation Dropdown Popup [[Tiddler Creation]]

title: Link from wikilabs: 272fa574b22bc9791fb2
text:
! Multiline Field Editor

This plugin adds a field selector above the text editor and a new button that allows you to edit different fields in multiline edit mode side by side

title: Link from wikilabs: 31c8c10d214182620206
text:
! Link to Tabs Pugin

This plugin adds internal tiddler links to every tab if selected. This comes in handy, if you are creating a lot of new stuff.

title: Link from wikilabs: 3aa4426f31dcc7fadab8
text:
! Field Visibility Toggle

This plugin adds a toggle button to the "visibility tab" in the tiddler info area, which can be seen in tiddler view mode.

title: Link from wikilabs: 3af998403ac42c977407
text:
! Field Search Plugin

This plugin adds several new tabs to the search dropdown. The elements, that should be used can be configured in the ~$:/ControlPanel

title: Link from wikilabs: 3d6a6d468e6a2ea0d8fd
text:
! Uni-link Plugin

This plugin add several new options to use the TW "link-syntax" in an extended way. It also adds an "aliasing" system to the wiki.
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link Alias WikiText Editor UI Filter Formatting [[Advanced Search]]

title: Link from wikilabs: 49c6b2b10a89d8b5537a
text:
! Script Manager Edition

This edition was mainly created to support a video series, that show, how the edition was created: Step by Step

title: Link from wikilabs: 4a48a81a1fdc95638372
text:
! Multicolumn Dropdown Plugin

This plugin changes most dropdown dialogs into multi column dialogs, with CSS only. This plugin is handy, if you have a lot of tags
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link UI Tagging Editor Dropdown Popup CSS

title: Link from wikilabs: 62b9e79ad0346f0c910a
text:
! Thin Scrollbars Plugin

This plugin adds a little bit of CSS to create thin scrollbars for ~FireFox and ~WebKit-based browsers

title: Link from wikilabs: 6e88261d4f2797d0f1f5
text:
! tocP - Parent Based TOC

This plugin creates the same UI as the TW core "Table of Contents" macro, ''but'' it uses a different field, to create the outline structure.
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link [[Table of Contents]] Outliners Linking Navigation Editor

title: Link from wikilabs: 7fe4ec4ca1671523cc77
text:
! Bundler Plugin

This plugin allows you to create "export/import" configurations and save them as a bundle.

title: Link from wikilabs: 85b579b38b34babc8f69
text:
! Deprecated

A similar function is part of the TW core since v5.1.14 see: [[ControlPanel : Settings|https://tiddlywiki.com/#%24%3A%2Fcore%2Fui%2FControlPanel%2FSettings%2FInfoPanelMode]]

! Info Session Plugin

This plugin provides a tiddler info button, with a persistent open/close status for one browser session.

title: Link from wikilabs: 9ad70f1d895fb529d40a
Link from wikilabs: 9de818b9525fde2f435b
text:
! Deprecated

This plugin uses a 3rd party markdown-it library V 9.1.1

! Markdown-it Plugin

This is a demo of ~TiddlyWiki5 incorporating a plugin for the "markdown-it" markdown parser.

title: Link from wikilabs: ae7b4202ce40244b06d7
text:
! Edit Tabs Plugin

This plugin adds internal tiddler links to every tab if selected. It adds a setting to the ~ControlPanel: Settings tab, that allows you to activate "non system" tiddlers directly in edit mode. This comes in handy, if you are creating a lot of new stuff.

title: Link from wikilabs: b3396be01db9875ceffe
text:
!! Backup

If you use the `<$trigger>` widget, with variables defined in the wrong way, it has the potential to "brick" your wiki!

So having ''backups'' is extremely important!

This plugin allows you have mouse "click animations"

title: Link from wikilabs: c966b52630f43dc16c92
text:
! Custom Markup Plugin

This plugin can be used to apply new wikitext formatting to content, that is imported (copy / pasted) from other sites. It allows you to improve the writing speed and it improves plain text readability.

This is a "power-user tool"!

title: Link from wikilabs: cda887ff3f7d1293f5ce
text:
! Info ~TagMap Plugin

This plugin adds a "tag map" to the tiddler info area.

title: Link from wikilabs: dc84de99f8ce733f635f
text:
! ~WebDav last-modified Plugin

This saver uses `last-modified` and `if-unmodified-since` HTTP header attributes, to detect file inconsistencies, which allows the server to activate server-side file compression.

The core PUT saver uses etags, which don't work, if server-side file compression is active.
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link Webdav Saving Developer Server Tools

title: Link from wikilabs: dee86687d2dd450db79b
text:
! Key Values Plugin

This plugin adds new filter operators that improves and simplifies Data-Tiddler handling.
tags: Plugin $:/tags/Link Developer [[Advanced Tools]] Searching Operators Filter

title: Link from wikilabs: df659b5b241004da44b5
text:
! Click Effect Plugin

This plugin starts a little animation if the left mouse button is released

title: Link from wikilabs: e35b41d51b6205cc2f6b
text:
! Special Links Plugin

This plugin adds the possibility to have Camel_Case links, that are otherwise not supported by default wikitext

title: Link from wikilabs: e53b7250d00c7d0f231a
text:
! Deprecated

A similar function is part of the TW core since V5.2.0 See: https://tiddlywiki.com/#HTML%20in%20WikiText : ''Pragma Comments''

! Pragma Comment

This plugin allows developers to add comments outside of "macro definitions", so they don't waste any time during execution. This is _not_ possible with the default wikitext

```
\\ comment comes here till the end of the line
\define test() Hello World
```

title: Link from wikilabs: f066790f97788d89783f
text:
! Remove States

This plugin creates a simple UI, to remove all state tiddlers.
